intro: Wrightia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan Wrightia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found near streams or in moist habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
